But the recent anti-Semitic attacks in New York make it clear that we need to do much more to counter this threat.

I also supported the inclusion of a provision in #NDAA20 directing @FBI @DHSgov & @ODNIgov to commission a report on how the federal government can more effectively prevent acts of domestic terrorism.
The Senate passed the bill last week and I look forward to the President signing it into law. (2/4)

I was proud to cosponsor @BennieGThompsonâ€™s bipartisan bill authorizing $75 million annually for @DHSgovâ€™s Nonprofit Security Grant Program which helps synagogues & other faith-based organizations and nonprofits secure their facilities against a potential terrorist attack.(1/4)

This is an emergency. We must do all we can to combat the disturbing rise of anti-Semitic attacks in our communities. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/28/nyregion/monsey-synagogue-stabbing-anti-semitic.htmlÂ â€¦

I cosponsored the bill which passed the House last week that would repeal the cap on State and Local Tax (SALT) deduction through 2021.

There is no reason the Senate shouldnâ€™t do the same and provide much needed tax relief to middle-class families. https://news.bloombergtax.com/daily-tax-report/states-face-uphill-battle-to-ditch-the-salt-cap-in-2020Â â€¦

The recent hate-fueled attacks on the Jewish community are appalling and an affront to all decent New Yorkers. We must do more to combat anti-Semitism and put an end to these senseless acts of violence. https://www.npr.org/2019/12/27/791732222/new-york-to-increase-police-presence-after-anti-semitic-attacksÂ â€¦

#USMCA is a transformative new trade agreement that will defend American jobs, support workersâ€™ rights, and protect our environment.

I voted to impeach President Trump for both abuse of power and obstruction of Congress. 

While I took no pleasure in casting these votes, I believe they were necessary to hold the President accountable for his actions. https://kathleenrice.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1498Â â€¦

If we refuse to hold the President accountable and defend the rule of law, then we are setting a dangerous precedent for future leaders that threatens the future of our democracy.

We cannot allow this to happen. That's why today I will vote to impeach President Donald Trump.

I was a prosecutor for a long time. And if I ever heard a juror say something like this, I would ask that they be removed from the jury immediately.

This is just the latest reason why Mitch McConnell should recuse himself from a trial. https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/17/politics/mcconnell-impartial-juror-impeachment/index.html?utm_source=twCNN&utm_content=2019-12-18T02%3A07%3A50&utm_term=link&utm_medium=socialÂ â€¦
